intro: Pouteria elegans var. micrantha, commonly known as the small-fruited soursop, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, dark green leaves and fragrant, white flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits with a thick, spiny rind and a sweet, aromatic pulp. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its edible fruit and ornamental value.
